intro: Kengyilia zadoiensis, commonly known as the Zadoi's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a yellow center. It thrives in alpine environments and is adapted to cold, high-altitude climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
